citeinfo.title: Nest Locations for the Kittlitz Murrelet

descript.abstract: A compilation of all known nest records and locations to identify landscape-scale parameters (distance to coast, elevation, slope, and land cover) that provide potential nesting habitat in four regions: northern Alaska, Aleutian Islands, Alaska Peninsula Mountains and Kodiak Island, and Pacific Coastal Mountains (including nearshore interior Canada).
descript.purpose: This table provides a approximate nest locations for Kittlitz's Murrelet (Brachyramphus brevirostris) in nesting habitat in Alaska, Russia and nearshore Canada

timeperd.current: Historical source dates listed under the source field.

idinfo.useconst: The authors of these data require that users direct any questions pertaining to appropriate use or assistance with understanding limitations and interpretation of the data to the individuals/organization listed in the Point of Contact section.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

dataqual.logic: Visual estimate on some nest location were done. The location and extent of other possible nesting areas throughout most of its range remains unclear.
dataqual.complete: Data is complete but there are areas where nests have not been located, but likely exist.

procstep.procdesc: All nest site were tabulated from all known sources from 1904 through 2012. The veracity and locational accuracy of these nests was then determined by consulting original information sources.

enttyp.enttypd: Table list of Kittlitz Murrelet nest location in North America and Russia.

attr.attrdef: Unique alpha numeric code which identifies the nest. Nest name from original data source

attrdomv.udom: Alpha numeric code for creating a name to uniquely identify the nest.

attr.attrdef: Region in which nest is located; regions are Northern Alaska (NOAK), Aleutian Islands (AI), Alaska Peninsula Mountains (APM), and Pacific Coastal Mountains (PCM), Russia (RU); see manuscript for additional information on how regions were chosen.

attrdomv.udom: Entries represent 5 regions that the nest were located and which are listed in the definition section. These are AI, APM, NOAK, PCM, RU.

attr.attrdef: Date the nest was discovered, if known.
Geographic datum of the Latitude and Longitude

edom.edomvd: Establish Datum for geograhpic coordinate system

attr.attrdef: How the nest was discovered. Detection methods are 1. Opportunistic (found accidentally, not by active searching), 2. Telemetry (found by tracking radio-telemetered bird to nest site), and 3. Nest Searching (found by active searching for murrelet nests).

attrdomv.udom: Only 3 options exist for entries in this field: nest searching, opportunistic, telemetry

attr.attrdef: Horizontal accuracy of nest location. Categories are Very low (>1 km), Low (500 m – 1 km), Medium (100 – 500 m), and High (<100 m; see Table 1 of manuscript)

Veracity of nest. Nests were classified as (1) “Confirmed” if it was observed directly and species identification was unequivocal, (2) “Probable” if it was located using aerial telemetry tracking of radio-marked Kittlitz’s Murrelets with at least two non-consecutive inland locations (suggesting incubation exchange between adults), or (3) “Possible” if it was either a terrestrial site where only one aerial telemetry location was obtained or a nest record with uncertain species identification (due to confusion with the Marbled Murrelet [B. marmoratus], a congeneric species that sometimes nests in similar habitat.

attrdomv.udom: Three options for field entries: Confirmed, Possible, Probable,
Represent the name of the person who located the nest.
